author: senh
title: Strike at NYC Airports Averted
text: BING NEWS: Walkout at 2 NYC Airports Called Off After Deal Reached NEW YORK — A walkout among some baggage handlers, security guards and other workers at New York's two major airports has been averted after the subcontractor they work for reached a deal with the union that seeks to represent them. Local 32BJ of the ... 07/22/2015 - 7:48 am | View Link Agreement reached to avert threatened strike at NYC's 2 major airports The union representing more than 1,000 subcontracted airport security officers, baggage handlers and wheelchair attendants says an agreement has been reached to avert a strike at New York City's two major airports, Kennedy and LaGuardia. Officials with ... 07/22/2015 - 7:20 am | View Link More than 1,000 NYC airport workers are going on strike starting tonight Over 1,000 baggage handlers, security workers and wheelchair attendants that work at JFK and LaGuardia plan to go on strike tonight and tomorrow morning ... If you have a flight out of either of those airports around those times, you might want to check ... 07/22/2015 - 5:30 am | View Link Workers to Go Ahead for NYC Airports Strike 36:06 - Bloomberg’s Julia Verlaine reports possible job cuts as Barclays tries to cut costs. She speaks with Jonathan Ferro on Bloomberg Television’s “On The Move.” (Source: Bloomberg) 07/22/2015 - 3:37 am | View Link NYC airport workers scheduled to strike Kennedy International Airport and LaGuardia Airports could walk off the job Wednesday night. Security officers, baggage handlers and wheelchair attendants plan to hit the picket line at 10 p.m. at JFK. They are scheduled to strike at LaGuardia at 6 a.m ...
